website_summaries.verdict: The best car monitoring tool that offers a complete solution for diagnosing various issues.
pros: Car monitor can interpret and view more stats and parts than most other monitoring options
The app interface makes it easy to switch around to different screens and tests quickly
cons: Monitor offers no way to translate error codes into layman's terms without extra research

customer_reviews.title: Did not isolate ABS sensor fault to the faulty hub.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to diagnose which wheel of my anti-lock brake system needed a hub replacement. All it told me is that I have a stored anti-lock brake fault, not which wheel it was. I had to go to my local auto part store and have their scanner tell me it is the left rear wheel sensor. I am not happy with the fact that it was not able to isolate the problem when clearly the fault code that was stored in the vehicle indicates which wheel sensor is faulty. The vehicle is a 2004 Pontiac Montana AWD.
customer_reviews.author: Red Lodger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $100
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty disappointed by this scan tool. The UI is very cluttered, and live data is very hard to use effectively. I am a professional auto mechanic that normally uses high end diagnostic tools, but I was looking for a sleek pocket tool for my phone. I have not tried the cheaper versions, but they really can’t be any worse than this. But for $100, this blue driver is nothing more than clever marketing and pretty screenshots. Not worth the money at all.
customer_reviews.author: michael rogers

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: This code reader is very inconsistent. One minute, I don't have any codes, the next I'll get codes, then I'll get "no codes".
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description.
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam guys I dont know how it gets those good review. I purchased this thing because my chevy equinox had an airbag light on . It says in the description that it works with gm vehicles including Chevrolet. I plug this thing in and it wouldn't pull up any air bag codes nor would it clear the code. When I called them they said it wont pull the code for my vehicle while their description says it will . Total lies and waste of time . I'm returning it. It was too good to be true anyways .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing will save you cash.
customer_reviews.text: I should've written a review for this along time ago. This thing saved me money. And I mean a lot of money. I recently bought a used car and this helped me weed out like 10 lemons. Ended up buying a car that was in much better shape for a really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: LittleReadBooks 'n' MoreTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Beware BlueDriver Defective
customer_reviews.text: Received the BlueDriver and installed the Android Software. The device would pair with the phone but the blue light never came on the unit. Called BlueDriver technical support and was told that since the device paired and the blue light never came on the unit was defective. The support person said that he would contact his mother office and have them send me another one. I told him that I was returning it to Amazon for a refund. Upon close inspection the box looks like it had been used before and am suspecting that this was a returned unit. For testing purposes, I attached another code reader and the port on the vehicle worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fully Support Subaru Available Operating Data / Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Subaru owners should save their money and use the ActiveOBD app with a lower price OBDII device if you are interested in monitoring key operating information such as CVT fluid temperature, Coolant temperature, etc. The expensive Bluedriver device I bought this week is useless in providing the range of information available in my 2015 Subaru Outback. Bluedriver needs to step up their support of Subaru owners if they expect recommended purchase or a good review of their very expensive device.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun

customer_reviews.title: Does not replace a professional scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wanting a small scanner that I could carry with me to auto auctions. I tried it at home first, (using it on a Samsung 9) it could not read an ABS light on, on my 2007 Dodge caravan. It couldn't give me the correct vin number and said it was a 1998 Dodge. I borrowed my brother's clunky Autel scanner and it told me RF wheel sensor. I tried the Autel on my brother's Ford Edge, said gas gauge wasn't working. This unit scanned no issues. I will be returning it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Now Older & Wiser

customer_reviews.title: this thing only works for check engine light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my ABS light is on. It said in the ad that it supported ABS but it don't have a function that mentions ABS anywhere.Did a scan and did not show a fault even tho the ABS fault light is on.deceptive advertising. I emailed Blue Driver with make and model of my truck and they told me it was suported for all features except air bags and tpms.Thats not true. here is the descripion in the ad...( Read and Clear Enhanced Codes: e.g. ABS, Airbag, Transmission, etc for GM, Ford, Chrysler, Toyota, and Nissan (available worldwide), as well as BMW, VW, and 2003+ Honda (available in North America), )
customer_reviews.author: Stanley H.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was, at best, marginally satisfied with this product until it quit working altogether. The iPhone app needed to use the device would continually show that it was “connecting” even after it was, to all appearances, connected and displaying data. Not a major flaw, but irritating. I was somewhat disappointed at the PIDs available for display, especially after the promise of detailed, model specific data fields. Failing to work at all after less than three months of service, however, is much more than minor irritation. Not only would I not recommend this to a friend, I would advise them to avoid it altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I could do my own diagnostics on my truck. I downloaded the software onto my tablet and tried to check the codes om my truck but was un able to. I'm self employed and was to busy to chase this issue at the time. So it sits on my desk collecting dust. I did make several attemps to ensure I did everything correct but the unit is faulty. I will have to find something esle when I find the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: William Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Would’ve known
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have all functionality that I was hoping for. Descriptions talk about having the most. I found out the OBDLX and mx has trans temp and few other functions s and track By that would’ve liked a little more and same price. It was really hard to tell by descriptions. Appears that there are a lot of functions it claims, but very limited on what it actually supports. Seems they system tracking is set up for future when they can provide support
customer_reviews.author: S. Fagin

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with any other app but bluedriver.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works okay as a code reader. I bought it to use as a boost gauge and to monitor other parameters, which the bluedriver app doesn't support for my vehicle but the torque app does. But this reader only works with their app. I wish it was stated in the description. I just want the next person to know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero for two
customer_reviews.text: Zero for two for what I needed. 2012 Kia Sorrento wheel speed sensor. It does not do that 2007 Murano engine speed sensor. It does not do that either. Save a hundred bucks and go to discount auto parts. They read it for free. Too bad it had some cool functions. But really should have the ability to read sensors since all modern cars have several of them.
customer_reviews.author: Fortheloveofreading

customer_reviews.title: Works for only a few years.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few years with no problems. Then when I actually needed it to read an abs code it no longer lights up or works at all. I've never been a fan of bluetooth anything to begin with so as convenient as it was. It's worth it in the long run to just get a normal wired scan tool.
customer_reviews.author: chris gennrich

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Connected twice beautifully 3rd time and 4th time completely failed complete waste of money buy the cheaper one definitely not worth it I have used obd11 for vw and Audi worked falsely this is completely a waste of money cannot connect to it 3rd or 4th time using Samsung s9+ which is definitely not out of date by any means
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No transmission temperature. No custom pids. No 3rd part apps.
customer_reviews.text: This dongle can not be used with other 3rd party apps like torque, etc. The main think I dislike is there is not pid for transmission temperature. It will not allow you to enter custom pids like 3rd party apps will. I should have bought a $20 dongle and downloaded a 3rd party app
customer_reviews.author: mimi streety

customer_reviews.title: it kept dropping out never did get a complete scam ...
customer_reviews.text: it kept dropping out never did get a complete scam on three different cars new focus ST new focus RS three series BMW. we thought it was the Bluetooth interfering but the BMW doesn't have it . couldn't get the app for my MacBook so I was going back-and-forth on my phone trying to learn how to use it gave up . Re-ordered one with the hard paper manual
customer_reviews.author: Stephenr Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I was not "lucky" with this product .....
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good contrition. At first connection in BMW 428i was working perfect. Feedback that provides is just OK nothing WOW about it. One week after I tested again in the same vehicle and was not able to connect to iPhone. After troubleshooting with "24/7 tech support" we created ticket. 24/7 tech support for PST is not actually 24/7, hey have someone answering on the phone and writing ticket for you, however real tech support is available over email next day. They offered to send new product as replacement however I have decided to return product and go with Foxwell. ($50 more but have designed for BMW with all fancy features you can get it).
customer_reviews.author: Milan R

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It has a great wifi connection but keeps freezing up. I felt embarrassed when I went to do a customers car with it and it kept freezing up. I tried it on my car to 09 Chevy Malibu same thing. It is not in the toolbox because I threw the box away by accident. Never again
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Funari

customer_reviews.title: Says it covers VW?
customer_reviews.text: Umm.. Your ad says that it covers VW's, but when I try to see the error code fixes. It says that they are only available for cars manufactured in North America? I there an ad on for VW? I think I will send this back and look for one that will work with my Eurovan.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Tranmission , ABS Does NOT support all cars
customer_reviews.text: 02 accord, 05 sienna, 03 highlander , Tranmission , ABS Does NOT support all cars : Returned for refund
customer_reviews.author: salam04

customer_reviews.title: Nearly useless for older vehicles
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to reset ABS & airbag codes for some older vehicles. At the time, there was little to no verification that the BlueDriver would reset those codes on the website. Needless to say--it does not work on my vehicles. It does work to reset basic codes but I have a $25 scanner that does the same thing. I would return this if possible because there is nothing special that an under $50 scanner won't do.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Savage

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Keep searching.
customer_reviews.text: Slow connection speeds (extremely slow) and inconsistent readings. Much better products are on the market. My friends CEL is on currently and the blue driver said no codes detected, I had to plug in my handheld scanner in order to determine what is wrong
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says, but didn't find the value relative to other OBD-II readers at 1/5 the cost
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with a cheaper OBD-II reader where you need to install 3rd party app. I would say this is more "apple" like, simpler to use, with its own app, and UI is more intuitive. But it lacks the customizability of the other app like Torque Pro (paid app) along with cheaper OBD-II readers at fraction of the cost. I would have preferred this one if it was same cost, but at 5x the cost, I decided to keep the other one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Hype
customer_reviews.text: The app is ok, there are others that perform the same operations for far less money. DO NOT BELIEVE THE HYPE ON THIS UNIT!!! It is no more than a code reader. Most of what it does can be done with a very cheap unit. I bought into the hype and was very disappointed. This unit is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Calvert

customer_reviews.title: Fair.  Inconsistent Operation.  App is nice.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Came in one day. Easy to navigate and pleasant app. Return was painless. Con: Bluetooth dropped randomly. App stopped working once. Was monitoring air mass flow on graph and went to change the graph scale and when I came back to the previous screen air mass flow was not a selectable parameter to monitor anymore. There had originally been more parameters than the screen would fit, but now only 5. Con or incompatibility?: Went to use Mode 6 (most important feature. I wanted to monitor misfire) and it said my vehicle did not support it. Maybe a flaw or maybe my vehicle just does not support it. 2007 GMC 8.1L Vortech engine. Galaxy S9 Phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected.
customer_reviews.text: Tried with tech support for 2 days to get this unit to work.. down loaded the app over and over. Still will not stay connected. Lasted about 30 sec. and would have to start over. Does not work .. Tried and tried. They just said sorry it doesn't work and refunded .. Total waste of time with a MB sprinter
customer_reviews.author: JZD

customer_reviews.title: Mode 6 are noing when your engine light comes on don’t work for older cars
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 3 cause it does do what it supposed 2 but I do feel your paying more for the opinion of others then the app does it self torque pro does so much more and the same,U can pay 10 dollars for a Bluetooth adapter and 3.99 for torque app compare to blue driver 100,that’s just my opinion,I think blue driver got a long way,They need Graphs more Diagnostic stuff,If not it’s just a over price obd2 with a opinions and Suggestions (Not for me)I’m sticking wit torque pro for now..
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: not for 7.3 liter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on my 2002 Ford F350 with the 7.3 Powerstroke. Plugged it in and was immediately prompted to remove it as it is not compatible with the 7.3. Would have been nice to know. Will probably still keep it for possible future use on other vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kapperud

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great for the hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for the hobbiest... Not for professional use. It frequently disconnects from Bluetooth connection. Then the only way to reconnect is to unplug from diagnostic port. After losing connection, have to re-enter vehicle information. I used it in sn older vehicle but may work better on newer vehicles that offer more pids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Torque Pro on Samsung Galaxy Note 8
customer_reviews.text: Despite doing my research and seeing other reviews saying this item works with the Torque Pro app on android, I could not get it to work using multiple different phones. All phones were able to connect to the BlueDriver device and use the BlueDriver app, but Torque Pro would not work no matter what I tried. Since this is the specific reason I bought the device, I'm extremely disappointed and I don't think you should purchase this given it's high price tag and if you're planning on using it with the Torque Pro app.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: The unit does ok with identification of codes. Every repair report I tried to generate came back with no specific information or actions. I tested this on my 2017 Corvette C7 and my 2018 Silverado. The database for the codes and actions needed are very insufficient IMO. You can easily clear codes but allot of database information needs to be updated for this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Works (for 6 months only)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for only around 6 months and one of the pins has already bent, which causes the unit to malfunction. Save your money and buy a less expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 40 days, stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a decent product based on reviews. My unit lasted just over a month. It just stopped communicating with app. May be this one is faulty unit. I was happy with unit when it worked, gives really good information on many codes. In my opinion, this Bluetooth device is slightly slower (reading codes) than wired one. For the price, they should provide a quality product that can last longer. My wired units are years old and still working great. Their customer service is useless too.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetboy

customer_reviews.title: DONT LOOSE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th one.. They are quite easy to loose. I own a car dealership, I bring this guy with me to auctions, works amazing!! Super fast, can tell if someone cleared a code and how long ago. Full system scans. best obd2 portable out there. Just need to make a disconnect alert so I dont have to keep buying new ones :)
customer_reviews.author: lindamstevenson

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad, But...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed considering that I thought BlueDriver at a hundred bucks would exceed my other 20 dollar device and app. I already had an inexpensive Bluetooth OBDII when I purchased BlueDriver, but that one would not read ABS. I was glad that BlueDriver read ABS on my Chevy without issue. However, on my Prius it's another story. The creators of BlueDriver don't seem to have much motivation to add diagnostic tools for Hybrids to read and diagnose their traction batteries. In this case my very inexpensive, (20 bucks), OBDII by far out-performs BlueDriver. BlueDriver could have been the BEST but now they have fallen behind.
customer_reviews.author: Aptly Informed

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I paid $100 for this and while it worked great it only lasted roughly a year. It will not read any car now. I’m not spending a $100 again. It still lights up but goes read when trying to hook to a car. Anyone can help I’d appreciate it Pittsburgh0535@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Can't add VIN Numbers for most Foreign based vehicles but a great tool
customer_reviews.text: It says that it works for most foreign vehicles at are not meant to be shipped to the United States. This is a fact, but you can't add the VIN number of foreign vehicles. It gives the codes but you will have to look them up online other than that it is a great tool once I figured that out. I wish it could add VIN numbers from these European based models so that service data can be tracked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue Driver
customer_reviews.text: Not worth 1 star that's the lowest score I could do. Technical Support was no help they said they would have someone call me back the next day never returned my phone call. Too much for the price not user-friendly and not compatible with any app other than the bluedriver I would not recommend this to anybody
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wendt

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after firmware update
customer_reviews.text: It worked for one day but stopped working after I updated the firmware. Customer support was incredibly responsive but I am not able to help them troubleshoot this product for consumer use. While it was working, it performed as expected but I did not have the time to get too far into its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Coday

customer_reviews.title: Great product but pricey next to the competition
customer_reviews.text: The product and the app seemed excellent. As someone who simply needed a basic tool for reading codes, the scan tool along with the app seemed more than I needed for the price that was offered. For a lot less I was able to purchase a well rated product that could provide adequate information and instead of the info provided by the app, I could do a search in google the provided the same info.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Got the blue driver and followed instructions several times in hope of it working. It wouldn't connect to my 2008 Chrysler town and country, or my 2004 GMC Denali 1500. It did however connect to my 2004 Honda Odyssey the one I wasn't currently needing it to connect to. Called the help line they also tried to help me ...they where very polite. But, nothing again by then was over it and figured out the issue with my Chrysler on my own without the device so sending it back. Main issue was it would not connect to two of my vehicles. Kept saying was unable to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy C.

customer_reviews.title: Reads/Clears check engine codes but not SRS codes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this assuming it would read SRS codes and it did not on my girlfriends 2008 Chevy Aveo. Other than that it will read check engine light codes and give you helpful tips to fix the problems but it didn’t do the job it said it would in the description so I will be returning the product and buying a scanner that does read SRS codes.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Grecco

customer_reviews.title: Average scanning abilities
customer_reviews.text: Very overrated. This scan tool only has the basic generic pids. Graphing can be scaled but the viewing in graph form is difficult to use for diagnostic evaluation. Basically does what your average scan tool can do minus the "most common fixes" with trouble codes, recall listing, maintenance schedule and the Bluetooth ability. Great for beginners, waste of money for experienced mechanics
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope. 2017 Toyota SRS light is not read/cleared.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to read a 2017 Toyota Sienna SRS light that randomly comes on and goes off before we can get it to the Toyota dealership. It says in the description that it reads these codes. It doesn’t. It works on other vehicles and shows basic information while in operation so it has value. Not sure it is worthy the extra min for the “pro” version of a code reader since it doesn’t work for this warning light. Sorry about the quality of the photo.
customer_reviews.author: mcoop

customer_reviews.title: Does not detect all dashboard light indicators on all make and models.
customer_reviews.text: Seems seems like a great product. It’s not compatible other than the check engine light on my 2004 BMW M3. Does not detect ABS,Brake,transmission. O2 sensors etc. Hopefully the firmware gets updated soon and has more vehicles that is compatible with.
customer_reviews.author: Katia

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and not worth money
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks for Cummins. Very slow to connect if it does at all. As with most Bluetooth devices this one is no different. Buggy at best. Would not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work With My Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Cool product...if it worked. I followed the instructions prior to use; installed the app, plugged into OBDII and started. The app said it needed to be updated in order to work with my vehicle, so I updated...after updating it still didn't work. I have a code appearing on my dash, but the scanner won't pick it up. Guess I'll have to go to a mechanic shop to have them read it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Being a Tablet Communication device to Your OBD2
customer_reviews.text: Kinda crippled as for flexibility using the software. Was hoping to use as a Keyless entry Fob Programmer. Better than than ELM327 but Not by much. It is a Basic OBD2 which has a LOT of Software Potential. Will see what future software has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Seeman

customer_reviews.title: Money saving tool
customer_reviews.text: doesn't do ABS or airbags on any cars besides American cars. Not was I expected since we own a Subaru. I would not purchase this product again. It was a little expensive for what it does. The description said it would do airbags but did not say specifically that it only does American cars.
customer_reviews.author: annette cleary

customer_reviews.title: Get a different scanner
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t clear ABS codes on my Toyota so I could see what ones come back. Wouldn’t read Air Bag light on my Kia. Wish I could return it but too late now.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I like the usability of the blue driver. Hower I bought it thinking it would give me information like technical service bulletins. Most codes read just provide the number no definition to code. Tried on domestic and foreign still no description on most codes. If i were to buy a code reader again i would buy something that reads codes and performs commands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Was told would read srs codes. It does not. Bluedriver locked to app. Does not work with Torque. Best bet to get Elm327 and Google vehicle data sheet. Android 8.0 Samsung S8+ 2011 Mitsubishi Endeavour
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: I will be returning it today
customer_reviews.text: Even tho this said it does air bag lights it wouldn't pull the air bag code on a 2000 Grand Caravan and it said it does live data but it doesn't do live data for abs so the common problem with GM full size trucks engaging the ABS under 6 mph can't be diagnosed. It also wouldn't bring up a report for a 2012 Ford Flex O2 sensor code
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Allen Stark

customer_reviews.title: DIY- Diagnostics (This isn't rociket science and you can save some money!)
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a few OBDII Scanners. Admittedly this started years ago when handheld OBDII cost $400, but this was matter of principle. Frustrated by an $80 charge by our local dealership for identifying the engine light was triggered by a loose gas cap. Nevertheless over the years OBDII scanners have save me and my friends who borrow my scanner some money. This is a very nice plug-n-play scanner and it is easier to setup than some of the WiFi OBDII scanners that look similar. Codes are retrieved quickly and a quick screen shot of the codes is always a good idea before clearing/resetting the check engine light is quick.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Stay far away
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. Used it for while, in fact over a year then it began to report false readings and finally while driving home from work it internally errored, caused the engine to stop and incorrectly reported problems with crankshaft position sensor, cam position sensor and errors with mass airflow sensor. I had the truck towed to my trusted mechanic who found a failure with the device. So pissed about the unnecessary costs plus dangerous failure while driving. Do not buy this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Horserancher

customer_reviews.title: Question asked about this POS
customer_reviews.text: If you look at the question asked to Lemur concerning this product almost every answer begins with “unfortunately “. Dont waste you money
customer_reviews.author: JEM2023

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced/not as customizable
customer_reviews.text: Ended up purchasing a less expensive yet great OBDII scanner (BAFX). While the bluedriver was fine in operation and has the bluedriver app, I couldn’t customize and add my own PIDS to monitor hybrid batteries and circuits. W a cheaper scanner w WiFi and “car scanner” iOS app it was about 1/3 the cost and more functionality.
customer_reviews.author: JamesH

customer_reviews.title: Works only if bluetooth connection is stable
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked great if the bluetooth connection is stable. I have a 2013 Mini Cooper S and the scanner would not complete it scan before my car bluetooth times out so it was worthless unless I had to turn on my engine running. There will be situations where the engine may not start and want to look at the OBDII code for troubleshooting. I had to return it because of this restriction. Their customer service support said they have never encounter a case like this. I find that hard to believe. The good part: Their customer service response is top rated. I got an email reply within a day.
customer_reviews.author: nerdie

customer_reviews.title: NO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I can't even give this item one star. It's that bad. It may or not find the bad code in your car. It's a lot of back and forth with the company as to what might be the problem etc. etc. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: stan m.

customer_reviews.title: Bricked
customer_reviews.text: It was fine until it bricked during an update and now it won't do anything. Tech support was unable to solve the issue so now I'm stuck with a $100 red light. Despite recent class actions, they still won't refund or support the product. It worked okay for about 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lunden Herndon

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because the check engine light has been on in my wrangler for a couple of months. This thing works so well that the light went off the day BEFORE it arrived! Thanks, BlueDriver! Truly an incredible product. Seriously though. BlueDriver paired using their android app immediately and on the first try. While i had no codes to check, i did use it to display all kinds of real time data--more than i will ever use. I'm going to keep this, because my car is seventeen years old so the check engine light is sure to come on again. I'm not looking forward to that, but i confident that BlueDriver will save me a bunch of money.
customer_reviews.author: karmadog

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper ones do the same thing.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and get a cheaper one. This does not read most of the codes it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi Stracener

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but Buy it Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. I was able to diagnose my ABS brake issue. However, I would purchase elsewhere, as Amazon openly endorses Marxist political groups.
customer_reviews.author: Biden

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Mine died after six months and the support from the Amazon dealer was zero even though they are the parent company that manufactures this device. I would go somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Nark

customer_reviews.title: For general use this thing seems fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional mechanic, so cannot speak to the accuracy of the detailed live diagnostics (although I've played with them and they seem to work very well on my vehicles)... but as for the typical user value, this thing is fantastic. I have a 2007 FJ Cruiser and 2012 Jeep wrangler and use the app on an iPhone; Bluedriver seems to work really well on both vehicles - finds codes when they are there, gives details on the possible causes and seems to find all of the subsystems for live feeds (just cannot compare to a second source to verify accuracy). For the money and convenience (I was concerned about the bluetooth) it has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Heartwell

customer_reviews.title: No SRS supported, so it is a 20 dlls reader.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, can't read SRS codes in a 2014 GM SUV, this thing has the record of fastest returned ever.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M

customer_reviews.title: this tool is awesome. I am not a professional mechanic but like ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok home mechanics....this tool is awesome. I am not a professional mechanic but like to fix my own cars. I have been waiting for an easy to use, powerful scan tool that helps the user interpret codes and fixes. This tool is it. It took me about a day to get used to how to scan efficiently and get what I wanted out of it. Already fixed a CEL...evap leak...top fix was....the $11 gas cap replacement. So it already paid for itself in one use. Rated 4 stars because, like some other users noted, there can be connectivity issues and you have to restart. Other than that...excellent product. Very much worth $100.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Guy.

customer_reviews.title: Wasted time trying this
customer_reviews.text: Wasted time trying this. It gives codes that a mechanic can read but not a average homeowner. I tried but was not able to clear the codes. I can not recommend this product or the similar ones like it. Either go to a mechanic or buy a better quality one. Here's an idea, go to AutoZ**e and they will read it for free. I have plenty of experience working on cars, just not codes.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: Thanks but no thanks
customer_reviews.text: Wish it worked like others, but no. It started out great, downloaded app, synced device, scanned my vehicle got a few codes . Said it cleared the codes . Vehicle starts with a check engine light still, re-scanned then it says there is no check engine light . The live data feature did not work as well and the Bluetooth connection kept disconnecting while the app was working .... so while it gave me the codes ... it was worthless for any other features , returned within days of purchase , waste of $100 .
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Mol

customer_reviews.title: No diagnostic for Lexus transmissions
customer_reviews.text: Works OK, but does not have Toyota or Lexus transmission diagnostic features which are the main reasons I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: SEM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on the Ford 7.3L Diesel!!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to receive the scanner, but when plugged it in, a message came up and said it doesn’t work with the Ford 7.3L Diesel engine. I’m not a happy camper at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Merry Jane

customer_reviews.title: Bug or faulty device or is it how it’s worthy ?
customer_reviews.text: App doesn’t show the possible diagnosis. Is it device or app? Which one has issue? It just shows code to me. I expected more on this device. I waited long to get a good deal . All in vain . My $10 Android OBD2 device shows more details
customer_reviews.author: Ram kumar

customer_reviews.title: Calling out BlueDriver. Prove me wrong!
customer_reviews.text: One star (i have a good reason). For approximately $100 of a scan tool, it is disappointing that after reading people’s questions and requests for the scan tool and the app to read transmission temperature, i recently contacted the company BlueDriver and after a few years, they still have the same response that they are STILL working on it. How can a company that is highly reviewed by automotive journalists on YouTube be lagging this long while the cheaper scantools with app counterparts already have them especially in modern cars and off road vehicles. I think they are getting lazy and just cashing out. I am calling you out BlueDiver. Prove me wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Battery problems
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of nerve-wracking weeks when my car wouldn't start with it installed.There's no certainly that it was the device, but it started holding a charge when the service people removed it. So, just be really careful.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, but hard to keep Bluetooth connected
customer_reviews.text: Great potential, but hard to keep Bluetooth connected. Using a Samsung Note 4 Cellphone, it is difficult to get and keep the BlueDriver connected. Tried on 2002 Toyota Highlander, and 2012 Toyota Highlander. It's a bit too aggravating to fight both car troubleshooting issues and the test device.
customer_reviews.author: AverageNiceGuy

customer_reviews.title: Get a professional scanner, this a toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok tool for basic gianostics but not for SRS/airbag or ABS. Bought this to read SRS code on 06 Element but the tool doesn’t even read SRS code/s. I had to use professional tool to get the reading on SRS and ABS. False advertisement and too expensive for basic OBDII reading. Just another gadget with bells and whistles but not true value. Would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Will not work with my Honda. One of the most popular vehicles on the road and you cant do live data.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: My engine light was on. I ordered this device (at the suggestion of an acquaintance). Luckily, I had another vehicle I could drive for a couple of days. I ordered it, and It arrived in a couple of days. I downloaded the App. Plugged in the device, it suggested some updates (which I allowed to be installed), and within a couple minutes, the BlueDriver was unpacked, installed, updated and ready to go. The BlueDriver Scanned my truck and diagnosed the problem. It paid for itself already. I now carry it in the glove compartment of my vehicle... I'll never again be left wondering why my service engine light is on.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Read SRS Codes as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The BlueDriver was promising, but I bought it specifically to figure out why my SRS light won't turn off. The BlueDriver insisted there were no SRS codes present even though the light was on and still is. Don't waste your money - this isn't any better than the devices sold for half its price.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Inoperable did not work was defective
customer_reviews.text: Did. It work, I have purchased this product before this is the second time of the three i’ve Purchased that did not work!
customer_reviews.author: Iam Joy

customer_reviews.title: This unit will NOT work on a Ford Diesel.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to work on my vehicles to include my 2001 Ford F350 7.3 ltr diesel. After I hooked it up, the app gave me a warning to remove it immediately as it is not compatible with the Ford diesel. I don't remember it saying anywhere that it would not work with this type of vehicle. I have not tried to use it on a gas engine yet so I can't rate it for that use.
customer_reviews.author: RotorDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Started malfunctioning after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved it for 3 months, and then the above screen kept showing up. I can still pull and read codes but the live feed Works only intermittently
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wade

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: My day to day job requires me to maintain a large fleet of vehicles. Employees would always inform me of a check engine or a dash light coming on. I originally had a OBDII scanner but it only read check engine codes. With the Blue Driver i can read check engine codes and other dash warning lights that come on. Since the scanner is connected to my phone VIA bluetooth I can also send the report in an email form. This device is well worth the money even if you use it at home for yourself. No need to rely on the repair shop to charge you to read the code or dash warning lights.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't test alternator or battery
customer_reviews.text: No test for battery or alternator. Hoping to fix my abs/traction control on BMW 2000 323i, no luck. No test for air bag. Looks limited for the price. Found something better. Time ran out for return.
customer_reviews.author: al adi

customer_reviews.title: Not for live data
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this device on YouTube and it seemed promising. A $100 device that can read live data? Awesome! The truth is the BlueDriver does not support most of the live data options available on the app. I attempted to read live data on a late model Ford, Chevy, and Honda. Most of the live data modules were not supported. Maybe 25-30% actually worked. $100 and the thing can’t read both upstream and downstream voltages on an O2 sensor. Most of the good reviews praise the BlueDriver for code reading. FYI, you can get a good code reading OBD2 device for $30 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Does not support Mercedes Benz. No time frame given by tech support
customer_reviews.text: Initial installation was clear and simple. Device initialize with Android Bluetooth quickly without issue. Live data is limited as support for Mercedes-Benz extended attributes is non-existent. Tech support team has no commitment relative to time frame for support. Bluetooth of the device conflicted with Bluetooth of the Android phone for both telephone and Bluetooth audio streaming. I had to disconnect the device and reconnect to fix it. As a standalone quick and dirty check for codes and diagnostics the tool is okay but for the price one expects live data to be more comprehensive as well as unique features for the manufacturer in this case Mercedes.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Return
customer_reviews.text: Product took forever to connect to the car. Didn’t like it. Started a return and it’s been 10 days since they have received the product and I haven’t received my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Best reader so far!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I bought it a couple years back and I have used it so many times on so many vehicles. It stays in the pickup now, have had several other people need it and by the time we were done every single person has bought one of their own. It’s sinple and full featured, everything from a somple misfire to a short in squib 1 on the airbag (glad to get that one fixed). I currently own 3 other usb readers as well as two professional obdII computers and this one hands down is my go to every time.
customer_reviews.author: KAEAM

customer_reviews.title: Did not provide ABS information on 2001 Jeep Grand Cherokee
customer_reviews.text: It seems a decent product. However, despite the description, it did not provide any information regarding an ABS light. Unfortunately that was the sole purpose I was purchasing the product.
customer_reviews.author: PDBNorth

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could've experienced it for longer
customer_reviews.text: Was great for a couple weeks, but then for some reason it wouldn't show up on any device, as if the Bluetooth just failed. Not exactly sure
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tacker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Crap crap crap crap crap. Never connected to any phone (Apple or Android). After contacting the seller I was informed that ODB II technology was apparently invented in 2010 since the device only works on vehicles from that year up. I guess the port on the older vehicles were in preparation for future inventions. BS. I returned it for a refund but the time had lapsed due to continual trial and error and convos with customer service. DO NOT BUY !!!
customer_reviews.author: Layne O. Royer

customer_reviews.title: fails to connect- not worth the money and hassle
customer_reviews.text: I was only able to use it three times, now it fails to connect to the phone. It says it's found the blue tooth device, but it never connects. I have tried uninstalling the app and rediscovering it in the blue tooth settings, but it makes no difference. it's just too bad it's out of the return window. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: MBlanco

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This OBO2 is probably one of the valuable product on the market. I just recently purchased a car and I used blue driver to detect if there is any problem with the car. Not only it detects the check engine lights and reports what possible problems but it also tells you if there is something wrong with your airbags and other type of stuff. You can also use the smog test before you have your emission test. It is also very easy to use. Definitely need one for your car and possibly save money from paying car mechanic hundreds of dollars
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment when I needed it the most
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product August 2019 and only use it about six times between then and now. Today when I went to use it to diagnose a problem with my daughters car I find that it’s no longer operational it doesn’t light up it doesn’t turn on it doesn’t do anything. I called technical support and they told me that the unit is dead and the warranty was only good for one year so I need to buy another one for $100. Great unit great design I like the way it works but if it’s not gonna last it’s not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Medina

customer_reviews.title: too many codes unknown
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 Mercedes CLS 550. I scanned it with blue driver. 1. There is climate control code B1450, no code definition available ! 2. system diagnoses B130E, no code definition available ! 3. Sensotronic break control / electronic stability program codes C0E51, ISO/SAE reserved ! C3266, no code definition available ! C0E4D, ISO/SAE reserved ! I called tech support and he said no one has reported that yet I cant do anything for you. So as advertised this will read all codes is false. I have run in to this problem with my Mercedes , Silverado and Sentra . There clams are over inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WORKS WITH VEHICLES SOLD IN THE USA.
customer_reviews.text: ONLY WORKS WITH VEHICLES SOLD IN THE USA. Just be forewarned, if you live in SA or Australia or any other country that gets cars which VIN's are not registered in the US Database the BlueDriver will not recognize the VIN number. You still have some functionality but you will have to manually look for the closest US equivalent and use that instead.
customer_reviews.author: RobbygTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It can isolate which wheel has a bad speed sensor on 2015 Dodge Challenge
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is exactly what I needed. I had an Issue with a wheel speed sensor on a 2015 Dodge Challenger. The BlueDriver simply plugged in, updated it’s firmware, scanned, and told me the exact wheel with a bad sensor on my car in all around 10 minutes. It also allowed me to clear the codes for the moment, though I’m sure the code will come back again but it’s a cool feature. I had been told that only mopar/Chrysler proprietary scanners could tell me which specific wheel sensor was bad so this BlueDriver, for the relatively low price, is a great value. The interface on the app is really clean and user friendly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doing okay for a bluetooth device however I bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: Doing okay for a bluetooth device however I bought it because of this statement in the write up "important information (such as ABS, Airbag, Climate Control, etc.) is left behind by the other wireless"... Only BlueDriver gives you the complete set of diagnostics on a wide range of manufacturers." But I have a 2012 Chevy Traverse that has an Airbag error that it didn't even acknowledge. So I gave this away to a family member that has a Dodge that is having miss-fires and he loves it because there is no wiring dangling around his leg.
customer_reviews.author: skippy

product_meta.title: BlueDriver Bluetooth Pro OBDII Scan Tool for iPhone & Android
feature_bullets: Read and clear your Check Engine Light and all other vehicle systems. Get your unlimited free vehicle specific Repair Reports, generated from our database of millions of fixes verified by Professional Automotive Technicians

As easy to use as a code reader with all the capabilities of an expensive handheld scan tool, plus the benefits of your smartphone or tablet (free app updates, portability, saving data, interactive graphing of live data)
Officially licensed and certified for Apple and Android devices
The BlueDriver App and BlueDriver Sensor work exclusively with each other to ensure quality
BlueDriver is the Professional OBD2 Diagnostic Scan Tool trusted by mechanics and developed by Professional Engineers in North America

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars16,521 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
